stem: The coolant temperature coefficient describes the change in reactivity per degree change in... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: reactor coolant temperature. -724- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following contains two isotopes that add significant negative reactivity when fuel temperature increases near the end of a fuel cycle?

choices.D: U-238 and Pu-240

stem: Why does the fuel temperature coefficient becomes less negative at higher fuel temperatures? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: As reactor power increases, the rate of increase in the fuel temperature diminishes.
choices.B: Neutrons penetrate deeper into the fuel, resulting in an increase in the fast fission factor.
choices.C: The amount of self-shielding increases, resulting in less neutron absorption by the inner fuel.
choices.D: The amount of Doppler broadening per degree change in fuel temperature diminishes. -725- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following will cause the Doppler power coefficient to become more negative?

choices.D: Higher coolant poison concentration

stem: A reactor is operating continuously at steady-state 100 percent power. As core burnup increases, the fuel temperature coefficient becomes __________ negative because the average fuel temperature __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: less; increases -726- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following pairs of nuclides is responsible for most of the negative reactivity associated with a fuel temperature increase near the end of a fuel cycle?

choices.D: U-238 and Pu-240

stem: Compared to operation at a low power level, the fuel temperature coefficient of reactivity at a high power level is __________ negative due to __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.B: more; buildup of fission product poisons
choices.D: more; increased neutron flux -727- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the curve of microscopic cross section for absorption versus neutron energy for a resonance peak in U-238 (see figure below). If fuel temperature increases, the area under the curve will __________; and negative reactivity will be added to the core because __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: increase; neutrons of a wider range of energies will be absorbed by U-238
choices.B: increase; more neutrons will be absorbed by U-238 at the resonance neutron energy
choices.C: remain the same; neutrons of a wider range of energies will be absorbed by U-238
choices.D: remain the same; more neutrons will be absorbed by U-238 at the resonance neutron energy -728- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following describes how the magnitude of the fuel temperature coefficient of reactivity is affected as the core ages?

choices.A: It remains essentially constant over core life.
choices.B: It becomes more negative, due to the buildup of Pu-240.
choices.C: It becomes less negative, due to the decrease in RCS boron concentration.
choices.D: It becomes more negative initially due to buildup of fissions product poisons, then less negative due to fuel depletion.

stem: In a comparison of the fuel temperature coefficient at the beginning and end of a fuel cycle, the fuel temperature coefficient is more negative at the __________ of a fuel cycle because __________. (Assume the same initial fuel temperature throughout the fuel cycle.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: end; more Pu-240 is in the core
choices.B: end; more fission product poisons are in the core
choices.C: beginning; more U-238 is in the core
choices.D: beginning; less fission product poisons are in the core -729- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the curve of microscopic cross section for absorption versus neutron energy for a 6.7 electron volt (eV) resonance peak in U-238 for a reactor operating at 50 percent power (see figure below). If fuel temperature decreases by 50°F, the area under the curve will __________; and positive reactivity will be added to the core because __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: decrease; fewer neutrons will be absorbed by U-238 overall
choices.B: decrease; fewer 6.7 eV neutrons will be absorbed by U-238 at the resonance energy
choices.C: remain the same; fewer neutrons will be absorbed by U-238 overall
choices.D: remain the same; fewer 6.7 eV neutrons will be absorbed by U-238 at the resonance energy -730- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the curve of microscopic cross section for absorption versus neutron energy for a resonance peak in U-238 in a reactor operating at 80 percent power (see figure below). If reactor power is increased to 100 percent, the height of the curve will __________; and the area under the curve will __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: decrease; remain the same -731- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of a curve showing the neutron absorption characteristics of a typical U-238 nucleus at a resonance neutron energy (see figure below). The associated reactor is currently operating at steady-state 80 percent power. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: taller and more narrow; decrease -732- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the curve of microscopic cross section for absorption versus neutron energy for a resonance peak in U-238 in a reactor operating at 80 percent power (see figure below). NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: decrease; remain the same -733- PWR Test Items

stem: If the average temperature of a fuel pellet decreases by 50°F, the microscopic cross-section for absorption of neutrons at a resonance energy of U-238 will __________; and the microscopic cross- sections for absorption of neutrons at energies that are slightly higher or lower than a U-238 resonance energy will __________.

choices.D: decrease; decrease

stem: If the average temperature of a fuel pellet increases by 50°F, the microscopic cross-section for absorption of neutrons at a resonance energy of U-238 will __________; and the microscopic cross- sections for absorption of neutrons at energies that are slightly higher or lower than a U-238 resonance energy will __________.
